intro: Spiradiclis napoensis, commonly known as the Napo spiral, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its spirally arranged leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of dense tropical forests. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
